Sponsored, Dubai (01-03 Nov 2015), Call for Papers, Tutorials & Workshops Proposals, Students Posters </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CYBERSPACE-AND-SOCIETY;91a5f4c3.1502</link>   <description> Dear Colleague,<br><br>Apologies if you receive multiple copies of this CFP.<br><br>Call for Papers, Submission deadline: 30 May 2015<br>2015 11th International Conference on Innovations in Information Technology<br>(IIT'15)<br><br>November 01-03, 2015, Dubai, UAE.<br><br>Conference website: http://www.it-innovations.ae/<br><br>Please feel free to distribute the IIT'15 CFP to your colleagues, students<br>and networks.<br><br>IIT'15 is technically sponsored by IEEE Computer Society. Proceedings will<br>be published by IEEE Computer Society Conference Publication Services, and<br>will be submitted for publication in Computer Society Digital Library<br>indexed in IEEE Xplore digital library, and all other global indices. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-27T12:03:17+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Fulvio Frati</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CYBERSPACE-AND-SOCIETY;91a5f4c3.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CYBERSPACE-AND-SOCIETY;b3524045.1502">   <title>CFP: 5th International Symposium on Cloud Computing, Trusted Computing and,Secure Virtual Infrastructures (C&TC 2015) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CYBERSPACE-AND-SOCIETY;b3524045.1502</link>   <description> [Apologies if you receive multiple copies of this message]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-25T11:02:59+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Fulvio Frati</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CYBERSPACE-AND-SOCIETY;b3524045.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CYBERSPACE-AND-SOCIETY;2556c0a2.1502">   <title>CFP: 12th International Conference on Web Based Communities and Social Media 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CYBERSPACE-AND-SOCIETY;2556c0a2.1502</link>   <description> Apologies for cross-postings. Please send to interested colleagues and students<br><br>-- CALL FOR PAPERS WBC 2015 - Deadline for submissions (1st call - new date): 6 March 2015 --<br><br>12th International Conference on Web Based Communities and Social Media 2015<br>Las Palmas de Gran Canaria, Spain, 21 - 23 July 2015<br>(http://www.webcommunities-conf.org/)<br>Part of the Multi Conference on Computer Science and Information Systems (MCCSIS 2015)<br>Las Palmas de Gran Canaria, Spain, 21 - 24 July 2015<br>(http://www.mccsis.org) [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-24T16:20:30+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Natalia Teixeira</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CYBERSPACE-AND-SOCIETY;2556c0a2.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CYBERSPACE-AND-SOCIETY;e5cabf3.1502">   <title>CfP - Rethinking Hegemony and Domination in Translation - slight revision </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CYBERSPACE-AND-SOCIETY;e5cabf3.1502</link>   <description> Dear colleagues,<br><br>Please find below another reminder for a special issue in the journal 'Target'. Please note that the submission deadline of completed papers has been moved forward to 31 December 2015.<br><br>CALL FOR PAPERS<br><br>Rethinking Hegemony and Domination in Translation<br><br>Special Issue of Target \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd International Journal of Translation Studies<br><br>Guest edited by Stefan Baumgarten and Yan Ying (Bangor University, Wales, UK),<br>and Jordi Cornell\ufffd\ufffd-Detrell (Glasgow University) [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-15T17:04:15+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Stefan Baumgarten</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CYBERSPACE-AND-SOCIETY;e5cabf3.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CYBERSPACE-AND-SOCIETY;86f0827a.1501">   <title>[CFP]: OSS2015 Ph.D. Contest </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CYBERSPACE-AND-SOCIETY;86f0827a.1501</link>   <description> [Apologies if you receive multiple copies of this CFP]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-22T14:48:43+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Fulvio Frati</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CYBERSPACE-AND-SOCIETY;86f0827a.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CYBERSPACE-AND-SOCIETY;86cc783.1501">   <title>CfP - Rethinking Hegemony and Domination in Translation </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CYBERSPACE-AND-SOCIETY;86cc783.1501</link>   <description> Dear colleagues,<br><br>Please see the attached second Call for Papers. Conf. on Open Source Systems (OSS2015) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CYBERSPACE-AND-SOCIETY;b4030d0.1412</link>   <description> [Apologies if you receive multiple copies of this CFP]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-04T15:12:04+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Fulvio Frati</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CYBERSPACE-AND-SOCIETY;b4030d0.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CYBERSPACE-AND-SOCIETY;744bccea.1412">   <title>CFP Risk technologies session at forthcoming Sociology of Risk mid-term </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CYBERSPACE-AND-SOCIETY;744bccea.1412</link>   <description> Relating with the Digital, Relating to the Future: Bringing Risk to Life<br>Session organized for the ESA RN22 (Sociology of Risk and Uncertainty) Mid-Term Conference \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdRisk, Uncertainty and Transition\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd, Stuttgart, 8-10 April 2015<br>Convenors: Nat O’Grady (University of Southampton) and Matthias Leese (University of Tuebingen)<br>Recent literature suggests that the rise of digital technologies in the back offices of governmental bodies, emergency responders, and a variety of private firms does not exactly seal a new dawn of technocracy in which the ability to intervene, to govern or control lies at the behest of auto-poetic software and algorithmic code. To analyse, [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-03T15:05:02+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>O'grady N.</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CYBERSPACE-AND-SOCIETY;744bccea.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CYBERSPACE-AND-SOCIETY;ca8540cb.1412">   <title>Call for Papers - Rethinking Hegemony and Domination in Translation </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CYBERSPACE-AND-SOCIETY;ca8540cb.1412</link>   <description> Dear colleagues,<br><br>Please see the attached Call for Papers. We would be grateful if you could distribute it as widely as possible.<br><br>Many thanks and best wishes!<br><br>Stefan Baumgarten   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-03T14:19:36+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Stefan Baumgarten</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CYBERSPACE-AND-SOCIETY;ca8540cb.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CYBERSPACE-AND-SOCIETY;bf79d270.1411">   <title>ECIS 2015 | 10 Days | CfP for Track: Media Management and Information Systems | 10 Days Left | Strict Deadline 28th November </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CYBERSPACE-AND-SOCIETY;bf79d270.1411</link>   <description>Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CYBERSPACE-AND-SOCIETY;bf79d270.1411">ECIS 2015 | 10 Days | CfP for Track: Media Management and Information Systems | 10 Days Left | Strict Deadline 28th November </a></description>   <dc:date>2014-11-18T22:56:06+02:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Artur Lugmayr</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CYBERSPACE-AND-SOCIETY;bf79d270.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CYBERSPACE-AND-SOCIETY;e28a74f.1406">   <title>Future Internet Special Issue on Digital Inequalities </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CYBERSPACE-AND-SOCIETY;e28a74f.1406</link>   <description> The journal Future Internet is accepting submissions for a special issue on &quot;Digital Inequalities&quot;.<br><br>http://www.mdpi.com/journal/futureinternet/special_issues/digital-inequalities<br><br>We are seeking papers that focus on how various types of inequalities - including economic, racial, gender, and sexual - are reproduced or mitigated through new media or new technologies.<br><br>This is the second edition of this special issue. 6 articles were published in last year's edition: [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-06-26T11:44:52-04:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>roderick graham</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CYBERSPACE-AND-SOCIETY;e28a74f.1406</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CYBERSPACE-AND-SOCIETY;ba655a7.1406">   <title>CfP: FINANCEcom - deadline 10/9 - Enterprise Applications, Markets, and Services in the Finance Industry, Sydney, Australia </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CYBERSPACE-AND-SOCIETY;ba655a7.1406</link>   <description>Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CYBERSPACE-AND-SOCIETY;ba655a7.1406">CfP: FINANCEcom - deadline 10/9 - Enterprise Applications, Markets, and Services in the Finance Industry, Sydney, Australia </a></description>   <dc:date>2014-06-24T17:45:08+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Artur Lugmayr</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CYBERSPACE-AND-SOCIETY;ba655a7.1406</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CYBERSPACE-AND-SOCIETY;94e6c48.1406">   <title>CFP: 2nd International Workshop on Security Assurance in the Cloud (IWSAC 2014) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CYBERSPACE-AND-SOCIETY;94e6c48.1406</link>   <description> [Apologies if you receive multiple copies of this message]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-06-17T18:13:00+02:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Fulvio Frati</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CYBERSPACE-AND-SOCIETY;94e6c48.1406</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CYBERSPACE-AND-SOCIETY;a0edd4d2.1406">   <title>2nd FoCAS Workshop on Fundamentals of Collective Adaptive Systems @ SASO 2014 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CYBERSPACE-AND-SOCIETY;a0edd4d2.1406</link>   <description> 2nd FoCAS Workshop on Fundamentals of Collective Adaptive Systems<br>Monday 8th September @ SASO 2014, London, UK<br>Workshop Best Student Paper Award: Prize 500EUR!<br>Invited Speaker: Franco Zambonelli<br>Hard submission deadline: 11th July 2014 (no extensions)<br>Paper Acceptance Notification: July 31, 2014<br>Camera Ready: 6 August, 2014<br>Workshop website: www.focas.eu/saso-2014<br><br>CFP<br>Collective Adaptive Systems (CAS) is a broad term that describes large scale systems that comprise of many<br>units/nodes, each of which may have their own individual properties, objectives and actions. (2014). The Leisure Commons: A spatial History of Web 2.0.<br>Routledge Studies in Science, Technology &amp; Society Series<br><br>http://www.routledge.com/books/details/9780415887113/<br><br>Note: if interested in reviewing this book, you can request a free 'review'<br>or 'exam' copy from Routledge<br><br>Website for further details: www.payalarora.com<br><br>About the book: There is much excitement about Web 2.0 as an unprecedented,<br>novel, community-building space for experiencing, producing, and consuming<br>leisure, particularly through social network sites. Dead Line: June 15th<br><br>http://postscreenfestival.com<br><br>The Post Screen Festival is calling for research papers about art, technology and culture mediated by screens, to be presented at the Post-Screen Festival Conferences in November, 28th ant 29th, in Lisbon, Portugal.<br><br>The theme for this year is Device, Medium and Concept in which it is intend to discuss the use of screen-based "devices" (traditional, analog or digital) as a tool used in artistic practices and social behaviours; This is the second edition of this special issue. 6 articles were published last year (http://www.mdpi.com/journal/futureinternet/special_issues/digital-inequality).<br><br>This issue will accept papers that focus on how social inequality is reproduced or mitigated online or through new technologies.<br><br>This is a good opportunity for both new and established scholars who are looking for a peer reviewed journal that has a quick turnaround (2 - 3 months). It is also an outlet for niche articles that explore social interaction online.
